docs.snippet: Trump presumably thought Pence would please Christian conservatives. But not all of them are happy.

headline.print_headline: Will Mike Pence Satisfy the Insatiable Right?
headline.main: Will Mike Pence Satisfy the Insatiable Right?

docs.snippet: Diego Dzodan was freed a day after he was arrested over Facebook’s noncompliance with orders seeking information from a WhatsApp messaging account.

headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Vice President of Facebook Is Freed From Brazilian Jail

docs.abstract: Brazilian authorities release Facebook executive Diego Dzodan from custody after judge overturns arrest order.

docs.snippet: Don’t scrub the letters L.G.B.T. from what happened in Orlando.

headline.main: A Time to Stand With Gay Americans

docs.snippet: Despite the appeal of the nascent product, any revenue gain for broadcasters remains a vague promise.

headline.main: Facebook’s Live Videos Get Lots of Looks but No Money Yet

docs.abstract: Facebook's live video feature, which became widely available two months ago, is enticing media companies with its possibilities, but questions remain about monetization; Facebook is eager for partners, but remains vague on revenue sharing.

docs.snippet: Why is it the developed world has to find fault in a developing country that organizes a major sporting event?

The company will report sales linked to its British operations, mostly digital advertising, through its local subsidiary rather than its Irish unit.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Alters Accounting, and May Pay Millions More in British Taxes as Result
headline.main: Facebook, in Accounting Change, Could Pay Millions More in British Taxes

docs.abstract: Facebook says it will soon change how it pays tax in Britain, possibly leading to company paying millions of dollars on its operations in country; move comes as American firms, facing anger in Europe over accounting practices, are rethinking their tax structures.

docs.snippet: 50 people were killed and dozens more were injured after a gunman opened fire inside Pulse nightclub in Orlando, Fla., early Sunday.

headline.main: Mass Shooting at Gay Nightclub in Orlando

docs.snippet: The online news start-up will begin publishing Circuit Breaker, a “classic gadget blog,” on Monday, primarily as a Facebook page.

headline.print_headline: Vox Media to Introduce Circuit Breaker, a ‘Classic Gadget Blog,’ on Facebook
headline.main: Vox Media Tries Something Old on Something New

docs.abstract: Vox Media, SB Nation and The Verge say they will start publishing Circuit Breaker, gadget blog for hard-core technology fans; blog will exist primarily as Facebook page and will be edited by Paul Miller.

docs.snippet: American power has lost credibility, moral conviction has eroded, and a Syrian city bleeds to death.

headline.main: America’s Retreat and the Agony of Aleppo
